name: Katie Mummah
body:
# Introduction
Undergraduate student studying Nuclear, Plasma, and Radiological Engineering at the University of Illinois.  
  
Will be seeking graduate Research Assistantship or Teaching Assistantship to earn a MS and PhD in Nuclear Engineering starting in fall 2017.  
  
Interests include: nuclear fuel cycle, nuclear materials. Also interested in design and implementation of new reactors, including Small Modular Reactors

# Education
### University of Illinois
Bachelor of Science May 2017  
Nuclear, Plasma, and Radiological Engineering  
  
Concentration in Power, Safety, & the Environment  
Minor in Atmospheric Sciences

# Internships
## Idaho National Lab
### Fuels Modeling & Simulation Intern
May 2016-August 2016  
* Experience running simulations using the BISON fuel performance code.
* Validated the code with Pellet Clad Mechanical Interaction (PCMI) data from the Halden Research Reactor. 
* Took a short course on C++ and a short course in Neutron Transport Theory  
  
## Exelon Generation
### Reactor Engineering Intern 
June 2015-August 2015  
* Developed communication tools to convey Reactivity Management (RM) concepts to 700+ plant employees. Tools included a quarterly newsletter, RM system of the week, and RM awareness posters around the site.
* Verified Special Nuclear Material Inventory and bundle orientations for all spent fuel (and radioactive sources) at the site.  
  
### Spent Fuel & Decommissioning Intern
June 2015-August 2015  
* Created a database which houses information about all fuel that has failed within the entire lifetime of Exelon's 23 nuclear reactors.  
* Aided Exelon employees in various projects including accumulating data on cycle burnups for 4 of Exelon's reactors, and verifying fuel moves at the Zion reactor, which is currently being decommissioned.  
  
## Fermilab
### Optical Astronomy Intern
June 2015-August 2015  
* Analyzed blue tip stars vs. galactic longitude with a focus on galactoseismology, ultimately finding a north-south asymmetry in color.
* Educated 30 high school science teachers about cosmic rays and cosmic ray detectors so they could bring those concepts back to their classrooms.  
  
# Research
## Advanced Reactors and Fuel Cycle Research Group  
Aug. 2016 - PRESENT
* Introductory experience in running CYCLUS fuel cycle code  

## Analysis of Reactor Transients and Stability Research Group
Jan. 2016 - PRESENT
* Gained introductory experience in running the BISON fuel performance code
* Continued development of BISON cases benchmarking pellet cladding mechanical interactions

## Experimental Thermal Hydraulics Research Group
Aug. 2015 - Dec. 2015
* Developed a Computer-Aided-Design (CAD) 3D model of a section of lab space with over 30 pipes and supports for use in developing laboratory experiments

## Contact
 * radioactivekate@gmail.com  
  
## [Check out my full CV here](https://github.com/nuclearkatie/CV)
